SEARCH
Package it.polimi.ingsw.view

Interface UI

All Known Implementing Classes:
GraphicalUI, TextualUI
public interface UI
This interface has been used to represent a series of common methods used in the various implementations of the User's interface (both textual and graphical).

  • Method Details

    • showNewTurnIntro

      void showNewTurnIntro()
      Displays a standard message to identify the starting of the next turn. Calls the nickname of the active player and the shows the board's state.
      See Also:
      • Player
      • Board

    • registerListener

      void registerListener(ViewListener listener)
      Registers the BoardListener on the Board.
      Parameters:
      listener - the listener that will register on the Board.
      See Also:
      • BoardListener
      • WebSocket.Listener

    • removeListener

      void removeListener()
      Removes the GameListener.

      Listener is the GameListener being registered

      See Also:
      • GameListener

    • setNickname

      void setNickname(String nickname)
      Sets the player's nickname.
      Parameters:
      nickname - the player's nickname.
      See Also:
      • Player

    • modelModified

      void modelModified(GameView modelUpdated)
      Method used to update the model by receiving a GameView object from the Server. Depending on the UI state and different model attributes this method changes the State of the game from the UI perspective.
      Parameters:
      modelUpdated - the updated game's model.
      See Also:
      • Game
      • GameView
      • Server

    • printException

      void printException(GenericException exception)
      Used to display a generic game's exception through the generic ui's logic.
      Parameters:
      exception - the given GenericException.
      See Also:
      • GenericUILogic
      • GenericException

    • setAreThereStoredGamesForPlayer

      void setAreThereStoredGamesForPlayer(boolean result)
      Setter used to provided stored game's for the player reconnecting to the current's game server.
      Parameters:
      result - true if and only if the game has been stored properly, false otherwise.
      See Also:
      • Game

    • run

      void run()
      Allows to identify the type of chat's command forwarded by the player.
      See Also:
      • Player
